Spring Wardrobe: Colorful Dresses & How to Don Them
Bright, vibrant clothes are in and are so much enjoyable. Plenty of people are afraid of brilliant colours because they do not know what to wear them with. Here are some ways to don your colorful dresses without freaking out about how to coordinate them with other pieces.

1. http://www.dressvendor.com/shop-by-occasion/wedding-dresses.html + neutral shoes + neutral jacket/sweater

This is the simplest way to dress in a colourful http://www.comdress.com/Wedding-Apparel/wedding-Dresses/85/cat.html?Neckline=Halter. Start with the dress (this is the Tucker Panel Dress)...

Increase shoes (these are the Stuart Weitzman Sashay pumps)...

Throw on your completer piece (this is the Banana Republic Textured Ruffle Jacket)...

Your jewellery, scarves, and belts can be similarly neutral- wooden beads or steel pieces work well.

2. Dazzling printed dress + coordinating bright shoe + neutral jacket/sweater

http://www.discount-gowns.com

This is a a bit bolder- and a lot more exciting- way to don colour, but it works greatest with a print. Exact coordinating of your shoes to your attire very often appears dated and matronly (or, weird because it looks, juvenile), thus toprevent seeking dowdy or just ill-informed, don't coordinate your shoes to your solid colored http://www.comdress.com/Wedding-Apparel/wedding-Dresses/85/cat.html?Neckline=One-Shoulder. On the other hand, picking up a colour in a printed gown is a great way to create a lot more colour to an outfit.

Start with the http://www.discount-gowns.com/wedding-dresses.html?wedding_dresses_neckline=11 (this is another Tucker gown)...

Jewellery, scarves, and belts may be similarly colorful, when done the same way- not matchy, but obtaining a color in the print. In cases like this, I might include something orange, similar to a cocktail ring, to pick up the orange detail in the gown.

3. http://www.comdress.com/Wedding-Apparel/wedding-Dresses/85/cat.html?Neckline=Off-The-Shoulder + contrasting shoe + complimentary jacket/sweater

This is several of the boldest way to have on color, but it does not have to be frightening. Employ a little color theory and you can put on an much more creative attire. I don't profess to realize the intricacies of color theory, but knowing a couple of easy thoughts could increase your horizons, wardrobe-speaking.

Find the http://www.comdress.com/Wedding-Apparel/wedding-Dresses/85/cat.html?Neckline=High%20Neck color on the color wheel: blue-green. Take a look at the colors on the other half of the color wheel, the same length from the centre: yellow, yellow-orange, orange, and so on. Those are your shoe colors.

http://www.comdress.com

Let's try this with another http://www.discount-gowns.com/wedding-dresses.html?wedding_dresses_waist=34, in a more muted palette:

Find the color on the color wheel: Pink. Check out the colors http://www.dressvendor.com/shop-by-occasion/wedding-dresses.html opposite it, but which are the same distance from the center: Mint, Powder Blue, Lemon. Those are your shoe colours.

Discover the http://www.discount-gowns.com/wedding-dresses.html?wedding_dresses_hemline=30 colour on the color wheel again. Take a look at the colours next to it, also the same distance from the centre: salmon and lilac/lavender/orchid. Those are your completer piece colours.

Jewelry, scarves, and belts can be equally colourful or neutral, based on your comfort level.

Many women put colours together like this instinctively, but relying on tools like the colour wheel is a fine way to navigate putting on multiple colors. It's a modern, fun way to put clothes together. And yes, this formula works with prints, as well as solids.

4. http://www.dressvendor.com/shop-by-occasion/wedding-guest.html + same color, different shade jacket/sweater + neutral shoe

http://www.dressvendor.com

A subtler version of #3, this is a fairly superior take on wearing color, and one I try to use frequently.

Find the colour on the color wheel: red. Check out what is on either side of it, the identical distance from the center AND what is in it is section of the "pie": red-violet, red-orange, pink, and maroon. Those are your completer piece colors. In such cases, try to stick with tones that match that of the http://www.discount-gowns.com/wedding-dresses.html?wedding_dresses_fabric=73 (if you are donninga bold red,discoveran equally bold pink andmaintainthe pastels for something else).

I like neutral accessories with this appearance, but you can spice things up with some contrasting colors in a comparable tone, like cobalt blue or yellow.

And now, my charming readers, go forth and don gowns!
